website_summaries.verdict: A compact sander that should be used in tandem with a larger unit. Good for hard work in small spaces.
pros: Unit is well-powered for its size and does a fine job sanding
cons: Gets uncomfortably hot during prolonged use
Does not come with variable speed settings

customer_reviews.title: DESIGNED TO FAIL
customer_reviews.text: This sander worked great for a couple of days; until the little, tiny drive belt that is designed to be the failure point went bad. I copied the numbers off of the belt and bought two new ones, but the sander is designed in such a way that there is no tentioner tha you can get to. You CANNOT replace the belts simply. So, I forced them on and they both failed rather quickly. It has been sitting on a shelf for over 2 years now, collecting dust. I loved it at first, but now I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Well made small belt sander
customer_reviews.text: Well made, small belt sander. Perfect size for scribing cabinets or countertops. Small and lightweight enough for one handed use. Construction feels well made and durable, with no "cheapness". I was a professional carpenter (served 4 year apprenticeship) from the 70's through the 80's. Now I am an advanced hobbyist, mostly building furniture and doing home projects.
customer_reviews.author: Poor old dadTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: This little guys is awesome. It is a little heavy to use with ...
customer_reviews.text: This little guys is awesome. It is a little heavy to use with one hand, but more powerful than belt sanders I've used that are twice the size. The only reason I didn't give 5 starts is because it didn't come with a dust bag and the motor pumps out hot air right onto your wrist when it warms up. I can buy a dust bag and the heat isn't a deal-breaker for me. As far as value goes, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sanding cabinet faceframes
customer_reviews.text: This belt sander is the perfect size to hold with one hand while holding the work piece with the other. I use it quite a bit for sanding cabinet face frames and it's perfect for that initial knockdown. I would give it 5 stars, but as other reviewers have commented, it does get very hot, which makes it hard to hold on top after a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: BElway

customer_reviews.title: I'm a trim carpenter and use this as often as ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a trim carpenter and use this as often as necessary to facilitate proper trim/casing installation. I use 60/80 grit paper to quickly resolve install issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald P. Schyvynck

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for scribing and finish work !
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool !!! It works freaking great for scribing and fine finish work. I give it four stars because I didn't realize it came without a case:( it's lightweight and handheld, unlike the big bulky belt sanders of the past. As to who has saved my butt multiple times 👍
customer_reviews.author: Adam gallasch

customer_reviews.title: Great little sander the wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great little sander the wife loves it, small, light, easy to use. Belts a little hard to come by but if you shop around you can find them
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: We love this sander when it works
customer_reviews.text: We love this sander when it works. dust gets in the motor and it will not turn on. The last couple that we have purchased both overheated and started smoking within 5 minutes of use. it was too hot to touch.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: No need for a larger belt-sander
customer_reviews.text: Nice sander - much more effective than its size would indicate -- does a faster and better job than other full size sanders I have owned. Another nice feature is it can lay nearly flat on its side -- hold it down with a clamp and it is great for sharpening chisels, etc. This is a real tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great sander, works fast so be quick cause it will keep eating through wood. Steady as a rock, can be used one handed fairly easily! Average length on power cord, nice grip to it, feels very solid! Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Anna G.

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: The smaller size comes in handy when a full size belt sander is just to big. The sander is easy to control and does an excellent job. The selection of belt grits is good so you can find what you need. I am really glad I bought this and have used it several times.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have bought. The first was at Lowe's about 6 years ago. The motor finally died on that one and Lowe's didn't sell them any more. This is a unique belt sander in shape and size and does a great job. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jsowle

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Belt Sander - overheated too easily.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this size sander for its overall weight advantage and to fit into tight spaces; but after about 90 minutes of use, the machine overheated and froze up. I let it 'cool' for 3 days over the weekend and it still isn't working. Any suggestions to 'reset' the device would be appreciated. I thought Porter-Cable brand product would be a bit more stout and perform better.
customer_reviews.author: Allen M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great little sander
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty awesome. I like the compact size, easy to maneuver. I will definitely need to get a larger one, but this one I will be keeping.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This is a good tool for small to medium jobs that do not ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool for small to medium jobs that do not required the use of heavier sanders. I still think it weighs a lot for its size, plus it gets really hot after some use, and it takes a long time for it to cool down.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Arango

customer_reviews.title: Great sander. Only wish it came with a variable ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sander. Only wish it came with a variable speed. I can provide that via another cord but would have preferred a slower speed as well. Very well made. This takes about 1/16 off each time you use it so light sanding isn't what it's designed.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy V

customer_reviews.title: I used it on an outdoor sanding project and was very happy with the performance
customer_reviews.text: The compact sander works very well for its size. I used it on an outdoor sanding project and was very happy with the performance. One problem some might not like is because it is compact it takes longer than with larger sanders.
customer_reviews.author: J Tru

customer_reviews.title: ... purchase one for my shop - extremely handy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My son has this sander so I thought after using his that I would purchase one for my shop - extremely handy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: Great little sander, when used for what it's intended. Not for heavy duty sanding. It's a perfect tool for jobs in between the random orbital and a larger 3" X 21" sanders. Excellent for one handed operations like prepping countertop edges. Just a nice little tool to have when needed.
customer_reviews.author: ECC 9:10

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a few years and mine is excellent. It has never failed me, nor does it get too hot to use. I love the small size for many projects.
customer_reviews.author: HTG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sander and such a bargain.
customer_reviews.text: I am 75 and have little strength. I could hold and maneuver this sander. Moreover, the belt is easier to install and uninstall than on other sanders I handled. I perceive no deficiencies in any aspect of this sander. And it is such a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: blybly78

customer_reviews.title: This is one great tool! it has made my life much easier ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one great tool! it has made my life much easier as it can be used to sand many different materials, wood, metal, fiber cement boards, etc. Its small, light and has very good power for its size. Easy to control and has one edge is clear so you can get the sander in close to sand various surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Gene S.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Does get a little warm with extended ...
customer_reviews.text: Working as expected. Great buy . Does get a little warm with extended use but nothing I would be concerned about. Fantastic on vertical surface
customer_reviews.author: Walt Lumley

customer_reviews.title: Small Wonder
customer_reviews.text: small wonder and of course it gets hot! It is small and working hard. Hold the handles and you will be fine. I use mine for two hours straight.
customer_reviews.author: CFT Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little sander for doing fine scribing, like baseboards to hardwood, or cabinets to an out of plumb wall.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Turner

customer_reviews.title: A great light sander!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tool. I use it often to scribe materials after the initial trimming of a cabinet or base to floor. It's very light an very managable.
customer_reviews.author: mhis915

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best small sander I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Carnes

customer_reviews.title: Great small sander
customer_reviews.text: great sander . did a 2'x3' table top in minutes. But I due recommend you use it with a Vac as it really gets hot with out it
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: It has a very nice feature to connect the shop vac which greatly reduces ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this belt sander to trim plexiglass edges of an aircraft canopy. It has a very nice feature to connect the shop vac which greatly reduces the amount of dust / debris/cleanup. The small size helps greatly with control. While I haven't used to sand flat wood surfaces, I can tell it will have no problems doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy somnething else
customer_reviews.text: It worked for five minutes then it quit. Now I have to return it and get something else. And I'm stuck with the replacement belts that I bought.
customer_reviews.author: G. Breckenridge

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Nice a small but yet still powerfully
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Nice a small but yet still powerfully. As a professional carpenter I use it all the time for smaller one handed operations .
customer_reviews.author: anthony i.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Workhorse machine that is easy to handle. The problem with a lot of belt sanders is that they can get away from you and gouge your surface if your not careful. This one is easy to handle and makes beautiful work in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Boatright

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product ─ fills a big gap in the market!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! We use it with 24 grit belts to do care for our horse hooves!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, great quality belt sander.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sander! Just what I needed for counter top sanding!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Great for projects that are bigger than my orbital sander can do but smaller than my big belt sander works very well, this is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Freitas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sander
customer_reviews.text: I am very much satisfied with this sander , one of the great things about this sander you can use it with one hand to accomplish the task you are trying to achieve the compact design is also a great feature to get into tight situations,which is a must for me as I am everyday tradesman. Great for all aspects of any woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this sander, more powerful than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Older Critic

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great about this sander except that you need to clean ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this sander except that you need to clean the wheels out from the saw dust that accumulates about every 20-30 minutes. We're working on our deck and 20 minutes comes around quickly. Other tha that product works great.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has been the perfect addition to my sanding needs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Tim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: What a great little sander for those one hand jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Ondrak

customer_reviews.title: BEST-FIVE-STAR....
customer_reviews.text: BEST PORTER-CABLE; I like Porter because is not that heavy.So I get ready to sanding wood in the garage later about 1 hour 30 minute all I feel little warm because is only 40 degrees outside and use vacuum to in porter that help keep in cooler and keep the dusty out. I don't use metal, hard wood stain and large paint area for example when use sanding on paint will stuck on belt sandpaper will cause over heat.I sanding on wood of walnut broad only I don't feel over heat.Now I am use for my craft
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performer, easy to handle and perfect for small surfaces.A lot of power for such a small unit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Best Belt Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best belt sander ever. Powerful. You really have to hang on.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Sivage

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my scribes. You can hold it with one hand which is why I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Hotdog

customer_reviews.title: but overall very good.
customer_reviews.text: Belt doesn't quite stay in alignment, but overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: The right tool makes the job easy
customer_reviews.text: This sander is just great! It is compact - but sturdy. I am a women in my late 60,s and can handle the sander with easy. I sanded some boards down today to make shelves. It took me 1/2 hour . With my rotary sander - it would be 1/2 a day. The right tools always wins. This sander is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Bad dilution of the Porter Cable brand
customer_reviews.text: Bad dilution of the Porter Cable brand. Incredible this design went to market. Hard to hold. Poorly located switch. Dust system fits no known hose. and port cannot be adapted. Runs hot... Belts not in stores so the price is triple what it should be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Hot To Handle.
customer_reviews.text: After 10 minutes this sander is too hot to handle. I'm making cabinet doors and this sander is the right size for the ruff sanding but after about 10 minutes I had to stop to let the sander cool off. I'm surprised Porter-Cable hasn't fit this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncey

customer_reviews.title: I loved the sander
customer_reviews.text: I loved the sander, but it quit after my first time of using it. It was exactly rigorous use. I sanded down uneven patches on a table top I built. Got pretty hot...not so hot it couldn't be held, but the heat was definitely noticeable to the hand. I let it cool, packed it away. The next weekend, retrieved it for another job, and it would not turn on. Don't know why, and at a week old, I wasn't going to waste the time to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and works great
customer_reviews.text: I used already, it's light, easy to use and works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: FOOD GUY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love porter cable. This belt sander is a huge help for scribing and making small adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: brent

customer_reviews.title: nice size
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for my needs. I use it for small projects around the house and it has been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Hike AZ

customer_reviews.title: Runs super hot.
customer_reviews.text: You WILL burn your hand if you run for 10 minutes. It runs incredibly hot very fast. I was sanding new floor and simply gave up on it. I could only use it for 10 minutes and had to let it cool for about 20 minutes. Do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kakalaka Rebels

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE 371 2-1/2-Inch by 14-Inch Compact Belt Sander
product_meta.description:
Includes 2-1/2 in. x 14 in. Compact Belt Sander - 371R, 80-Grit Sanding Belt, Dust Port, Removable Auxiliary Handle Amazon.com Porter-Cable's 371 compact and lightweight belt sander is ideal for DIY and professional applications like paint removal, above, and smoothing counter edges, below (view larger). The 371 compact belt sander features a textured rubber grip for easy one- and two-handed control (view larger). The Porter-Cable 371 2-1/2-inch by 14-inch compact belt sander is equipped with a slew of features that make it ideal for any number of DIY and professional applications. Its textured rubber body grip offers a comfortable and user-friendly non-slip surface for one-handed use, while the included auxiliary handle provides better two-handed control when required. Ideal for scraping paint off of metal and wood, flush sanding up against perpendicular surfaces, sanding down wood and composite materials, and more, the 371 also features a dust collector to keep your workspace clean and your project on track. Super Sanding at Any Angle The 371 sander measures 2-1/2 inches wide by 14 inches long and weighs just 5 pounds, making for a compact power tool with a textured rubber grip for easy one-handed control. Its low center of gravity delivers a balanced feel in a variety of orientations, whether you’re sanding a vertical surface inside a tricky recessed space or a horizontal surface at an awkward angle. The cord exit grip provides secondary gripping capability when two hands are necessary. Designed with a flush side so as to brush right up to a perpendicular surface, it covers a wide surface area. A dust-sealed power switch is recessed, allowing for accessibility while reducing the hassle of accidentally turning it off mid-job. The included removable dust port keeps your work area free of debris so that your space is clean and readily visible at all times. Easily and efficiently sand down tabletops or cabinet doors, scrape paint from wooden

AMAZON.COM


Porter-Cable's 371 compact and lightweight belt sander is ideal for DIY and professional applications like paint removal, above, and smoothing counter edges, below (view larger). The 371 compact belt sander features a textured rubber grip for easy one- and two-handed control (view larger). The Porter-Cable 371 2-1/2-inch by 14-inch compact belt sander is equipped with a slew of features that make it ideal for any number of DIY and professional applications. Its textured rubber body grip offers a comfortable and user-friendly non-slip surface for one-handed use, while the included auxiliary handle provides better two-handed control when required. Ideal for scraping paint off of metal and wood, flush sanding up against perpendicular surfaces, sanding down wood and composite materials, and more, the 371 also features a dust collector to keep your workspace clean and your project on track. 

SUPER SANDING AT ANY ANGLE
The 371 sander measures 2-1/2 inches wide by 14 inches long and weighs just 5 pounds, making for a compact power tool with a textured rubber grip for easy one-handed control. Its low center of gravity delivers a balanced feel in a variety of orientations, whether you’re sanding a vertical surface inside a tricky recessed space or a horizontal surface at an awkward angle. The cord exit grip provides secondary gripping capability when two hands are necessary. Designed with a flush side so as to brush right up to a perpendicular surface, it covers a wide surface area. A dust-sealed power switch is recessed, allowing for accessibility while reducing the hassle of accidentally turning it off mid-job. The included removable dust port keeps your work area free of debris so that your space is clean and readily visible at all times. Easily and efficiently sand down tabletops or cabinet doors, scrape paint from wooden stools or metal sinks, and more with Porter-Cable’s 371.

ABOUT PORTER-CABLE
With more than 100 years of experience producing quality and performance-driven tools, Porter-Cable is a leading manufacturer and marketer of professional-grade cordless and corded power tools, equipment, and accessories. Known for industry-changing innovation, Porter-Cable introduced the world’s first helical drive circular saw, portable band saw, and portable belt sander.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
One Porter-Cable 371 2-1/2-inch by 14-inch compact belt sander, one 80-grit sanding belt, one dust port, and one removable auxiliary handle.

HIGHLIGHTS
 * Compact and lightweight belt sander ideal for DIY and professional applications
 * Convenient one-handed use with removable auxiliary handle for better two-handed control when necessary
 * Flush side allows for sanding up against perpendicular surfaces
 * Textured rubber body grip for non-slip surface and metal components for durability
 * Backed by a 90-day money-back guarantee, a one-year free service contract, and a three-year limited warranty
feature_bullets: Textured rubber body grip provides comfortable non-slip surface
Flush side enables sanding up to perpendicular surface
Metal components provide durability for professional applications
Dust sealed, recessed switch offers accessibility while minimizing unintended turn-offs
Textured rubber body grip provides comfortable non-slip surface
Flush side enables sanding up to perpendicular surface
Metal components provide durability for professional applications
Dust sealed, recessed switch offers accessibility while minimizing unintended turn-offs
Removable auxiliary handle offers better control when two-handed use is desired. Cord exit grip offers auxiliary gripping for various orientations
